Pre-Game Insights: The St. Louis Cardinals and Milwaukee Brewers will face off on September 2, 2024, at American Family Field in Milwaukee.
The Cardinals currently sit third in the NL Central with a record of 69-68, while the Brewers lead the division at 80-57.
Rhys Hoskins has been a pivotal player for the Cardinals this season, hitting.262 with 24 home runs and 75 RBIs.
Against right-handed pitchers this year, Hoskins boasts a.270 batting average, which is impressive.
Freddy Peralta, the Brewers' starting pitcher, has given up 22 home runs in 148.1 innings pitched.
The Brewers' bullpen has shown some vulnerability in high-pressure situations.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Andre Pallante will start for the Cardinals with a 6-6 record and a 3.80 ERA.
Freddy Peralta will take the mound for the Brewers with a 9-7 record and a 3.70 ERA.
